Type%20Definitions.html#/c:Radar.h@T@Rad.name: RadarLocationCompletionHandler
Type%20Definitions.html#/c:Radar.h@T@Rad.abstract: Called when a location request succeeds, fails, or times out. Receives the request status and, if successful, the location.

Type%20Definitions.html#/c:Radar.h@T@Rad.name: RadarTrackCompletionHandler
Type%20Definitions.html#/c:Radar.h@T@Rad.abstract: Called when a track request succeeds, fails, or times out. Receives the request status and, if successful, the user’s location, an array of the events generated, and the user.

Type%20Definitions.html#/c:Radar.h@T@Rad.name: RadarSearchPlacesCompletionHandler
Type%20Definitions.html#/c:Radar.h@T@Rad.abstract: Called when a place search request succeeds, fails, or times out. Receives the request status and, if successful, the location and an array of places sorted by distance.

Type%20Definitions.html#/c:Radar.h@T@Rad.name: RadarSearchGeofencesCompletionHandler
Type%20Definitions.html#/c:Radar.h@T@Rad.abstract: Called when a geofence search request succeeds, fails, or times out. Receives the request status and, if successful, the location and an array of geofences sorted by distance.

Protocols/RadarDelegate.html#/c:objc(pl).name: -didReceiveEvents:user:
Protocols/RadarDelegate.html#/c:objc(pl).abstract: Tells the delegate that events were received for the current user.

Protocols/RadarDelegate.html#/c:objc(pl).name: -didUpdateLocation:user:
Protocols/RadarDelegate.html#/c:objc(pl).abstract: Tells the delegate that the current user’s location was updated and synced to the server.

Protocols/RadarDelegate.html#/c:objc(pl).name: -didUpdateClientLocation:stopped:source:
Protocols/RadarDelegate.html#/c:objc(pl).abstract: Tells the delegate that client’s location was updated. To receive only server-synced location updates and user state, use didUpdateLocation:user: instead.

Protocols/RadarDelegate.html#/c:objc(pl).name: -didFailWithStatus:
Protocols/RadarDelegate.html#/c:objc(pl).abstract: Tells the delegate that a request failed.

Protocols/RadarDelegate.html#/c:objc(pl).name: -didLogMessage:
Protocols/RadarDelegate.html#/c:objc(pl).abstract: Tells the delegate that a debug log message was received.

Protocols/RadarDelegate.html.name: RadarDelegate
Protocols/RadarDelegate.html.abstract: A delegate for client-side delivery of events, location updates, and debug logs. For more information, see https://radar.io/documentation/sdk

Enums/RadarStatus.html#/c:@E@RadarStatus.name: RadarStatusErrorPublishableKey
Enums/RadarStatus.html#/c:@E@RadarStatus.abstract: The SDK was not initialized with a publishable API key

Enums/RadarStatus.html#/c:@E@RadarStatus.name: RadarStatusErrorPermissions
Enums/RadarStatus.html#/c:@E@RadarStatus.abstract: The app’s location authorization status is not kCLAuthorizationStatusAuthorizedWhenInUse or kCLAuthorizationStatusAuthorizedAlways

Enums/RadarStatus.html#/c:@E@RadarStatus.name: RadarStatusErrorLocation
Enums/RadarStatus.html#/c:@E@RadarStatus.abstract: Location services were unavailable, or the location request timed out.

Enums/RadarStatus.html#/c:@E@RadarStatus.name: RadarStatusErrorNetwork
Enums/RadarStatus.html#/c:@E@RadarStatus.abstract: The network was unavailable, or the network connection timed out

Classes/RadarUserInsightsState.html#/c:o.name: home
Classes/RadarUserInsightsState.html#/c:o.abstract: A boolean indicating whether the user is at home, based on learned home location.

Classes/RadarUserInsightsState.html#/c:o.name: office
Classes/RadarUserInsightsState.html#/c:o.abstract: A boolean indicating whether the user is at the office, based on learned office location.

Classes/RadarUserInsightsState.html#/c:o.name: traveling
Classes/RadarUserInsightsState.html#/c:o.abstract: A boolean indicating whether the user is traveling, based on learned home location.

Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html#/.name: confidence
Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html#/.abstract: The confidence level of the learned location.

Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html#/.name: updatedAt
Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html#/.abstract: The datetime when the learned location was updated.

Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html#/.name: country
Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html#/.abstract: The country of the learned location. May be nil if country is not available or if regions are not enabled.

Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html#/.name: state
Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html#/.abstract: The state of the learned location. May be nil if state is not available or if regions are not enabled.

Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html#/.name: dma
Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html#/.abstract: The DMA of the learned location. May be nil if DMA is not available or if regions are not enabled.

Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html#/.name: postalCode
Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html#/.abstract: The postal code of the learned location. May be nil if postal code is not available or if regions are not enabled.

Classes/RadarUserInsights.html#/c:objc(c.name: homeLocation
Classes/RadarUserInsights.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The learned home location of the user. May be nil if not yet learned, or if Insights is turned off.

Classes/RadarUserInsights.html#/c:objc(c.name: officeLocation
Classes/RadarUserInsights.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The learned office location of the user. May be nil if not yet learned, or if Insights is turned off.

Classes/RadarUserInsights.html#/c:objc(c.name: state
Classes/RadarUserInsights.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The state of the user, based on learned home and office locations.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: userId
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: The unique ID of the user, provided when you identified the user. May be nil if the user has not been identified.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: _description
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: The optional description of the user. Not to be confused with the NSObject description property.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: metadata
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: The optional set of custom key-value pairs for the user.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: geofences
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: An array of the user’s last known geofences. May be nil or empty if the user is not in any geofences.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: place
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: The user’s last known place. May be nil if the user is not at a place, or if Places is turned off.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: insights
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: Learned insights for the user. May be nil if no insights are available, or if Insights is turned off.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: stopped
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: A boolean indicating whether the user is stopped.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: foreground
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: A boolean indicating whether the user was last updated in the foreground.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: country
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: The user’s last known country. May be nil if country is not available or if Regions is turned off.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: state
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: The user’s last known state. May be nil if state is not available or if Regions is turned off.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: dma
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: The user’s last known designated market area (DMA). May be nil if DMA is not available or if Regions is turned off.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: postalCode
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: The user’s last known postal code. May be nil if postal code is not available or if Regions is turned off.

Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.name: nearbyPlaceChains
Classes/RadarUser.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarU.abstract: An array of nearby chains. May be nil if no chains are nearby or if nearby chains are not enabled.

Classes/RadarPolygonGeometry.html#/c:obj.name: coordinates
Classes/RadarPolygonGeometry.html#/c:obj.abstract: The geometry of the polygon geofence. A closed ring of coordinates.

Classes/RadarPlace.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: categories
Classes/RadarPlace.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The categories of the place. For a full list of categories, see https://radar.io/documentation/places/categories.

Classes/RadarPlace.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: chain
Classes/RadarPlace.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The chain of the place, if known. May be nil for places without a chain. For a full list of chains, see https://radar.io/documentation/places/chains.

Classes/RadarPlace.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: group
Classes/RadarPlace.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The group for the place, if any. For a full list of groups, see https://radar.io/documentation/places/groups.

Classes/RadarPlace.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: metadata
Classes/RadarPlace.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The metadata for the place, if part of a group. For details of metadata fields see https://radar.io/documentation/places/groups.

Classes/RadarPlace.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: -isChain:
Classes/RadarPlace.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: Returns a boolean indicating whether the place is part of the specified chain.

Classes/RadarPlace.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: -hasCategory:
Classes/RadarPlace.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: Returns a boolean indicating whether the place has the specified category.

Classes/RadarGeofence.html#/c:objc(cs)Ra.name: _description
Classes/RadarGeofence.html#/c:objc(cs)Ra.abstract: The description of the geofence. Not to be confused with the NSObject description property.

Classes/RadarGeofence.html#/c:objc(cs)Ra.name: metadata
Classes/RadarGeofence.html#/c:objc(cs)Ra.abstract: The optional set of custom key-value pairs for the geofence.

Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: createdAt
Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The datetime when the event occurred on the device.

Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: actualCreatedAt
Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The datetime when the event was created on the server.

Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: live
Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: A boolean indicating whether the event was generated with your live API key.

Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: geofence
Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The geofence for which the event was generated. May be nil for non-geofence events.

Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: place
Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The place for which the event was generated. May be nil for non-place events.

Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: region
Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The region for which the event was generated. May be null for non-region events.

Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: alternatePlaces
Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: For place entry events, alternate place candidates. May be nil for non-place events.

Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: verifiedPlace
Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: For accepted place entry events, the verified place. May be nil for non-place events or unverified events.

Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: duration
Classes/RadarEvent.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The duration between entry and exit events, in minutes, for exit events. 0 for entry events.

Classes/RadarCircleGeometry.html#/c:objc.name: radius
Classes/RadarCircleGeometry.html#/c:objc.abstract: The radius of the circle geofence in meters.

Classes/RadarChain.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: slug
Classes/RadarChain.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The unique ID of the chain. For a full list of chains, see https://radar.io/documentation/places/chains.

Classes/RadarChain.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: name
Classes/RadarChain.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The name of the chain. For a full list of chains, see https://radar.io/documentation/places/chains.

Classes/RadarChain.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.name: metadata
Classes/RadarChain.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar.abstract: The optional set of custom key-value pairs for the chain.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +setDescription:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Sets an optional description for the user, displayed in the dashboard.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +setMetadata:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Sets an optional set of custom key-value pairs for the user.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)t.name: +trackOnceWithCompletionHandler:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)t.abstract: Tracks the user’s location once in the foreground.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +startTracking
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Starts tracking the user’s location in the background.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +startTrackingWithOptions:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Starts tracking the user’s location in the background with configurable tracking options.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +stopTracking
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Stops tracking the user’s location in the background.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)i.name: +isTracking
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)i.abstract: Returns a boolean indicating whether tracking has been started.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +setDelegate:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Sets a delegate for client-side delivery of events, location updates, and debug logs.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)a.name: +acceptEventId:verifiedPlaceId:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)a.abstract: Accepts an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)r.name: +rejectEventId:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)r.abstract: Rejects an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +searchPlacesWithRadius:chains:categories:groups:limit:completionHandler:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Gets the device’s current location, then searches for places near that location, sorted by distance.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +searchPlacesWithLocation:radius:chains:categories:groups:limit:completionHandler:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Searches for places near a location, sorted by distance.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +searchGeofencesWithRadius:tags:limit:completionHandler:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Gets the device’s current location, then searches for geofences near that location, sorted by distance.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +searchGeofencesWithLocation:radius:tags:limit:completionHandler:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Searches for geofences near a location, sorted by distance.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +setLogLevel:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Sets the log level for debug logs.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +stringForStatus:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Returns a display string for a status value.

Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.name: +stringForSource:
Classes/Radar.html#/c:objc(cs)Radar(cm)s.abstract: Returns a display string for a location source value.

Classes/Radar.html.name: Radar
Classes/Radar.html.abstract: The main class used to interact with the Radar SDK.

Classes/RadarChain.html.name: RadarChain
Classes/RadarChain.html.abstract: Represents the chain of a place. For more information about Places, see https://radar.io/documentation/places.

Classes/RadarCircleGeometry.html.name: RadarCircleGeometry
Classes/RadarCircleGeometry.html.abstract: Represents the geometry of a circle geofence.

Classes/RadarEvent.html.name: RadarEvent
Classes/RadarEvent.html.abstract: Represents a change in user state. For more information, see https://radar.io/documentation.

Classes/RadarGeofence.html.name: RadarGeofence
Classes/RadarGeofence.html.abstract: Represents a geofence. For more information about Geofences, see https://radar.io/documentation/geofences.

Classes/RadarPlace.html.name: RadarPlace
Classes/RadarPlace.html.abstract: Represents a place. For more information about Places, see https://radar.io/documentation/places.

Classes/RadarRegion.html.name: RadarRegion
Classes/RadarRegion.html.abstract: Represents a region. For more information about Regions, see https://radar.io/documentation/regions.

Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarTrackingOpt.name: RadarTrackingOptions
Classes.html#/c:objc(cs)RadarTrackingOpt.abstract: An options class used to configure background tracking.

Classes/RadarUser.html.name: RadarUser
Classes/RadarUser.html.abstract: Represents the current user state. For more information, see https://radar.io/documentation.

Classes/RadarUserInsights.html.name: RadarUserInsights
Classes/RadarUserInsights.html.abstract: Represents the learned home, work, and traveling state and locations of the current user. For more information about Insights, see https://radar.io/documentation/insights.

Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html.name: RadarUserInsightsLocation
Classes/RadarUserInsightsLocation.html.abstract: Represents a learned home or work location. For more information about Insights, see https://radar.io/documentation/insights.

Classes/RadarUserInsightsState.html.name: RadarUserInsightsState
Classes/RadarUserInsightsState.html.abstract: Represents the learned home, work, and traveling state of the current user. For more information about Insights, see https://radar.io/documentation/insights.

Type%20Definitions.html.name: Type Definitions
Type%20Definitions.html.abstract: The following type definitions are available globally.
